issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Move HiveMetaStoreClient plus a few remaining classes.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I think that it is caused by unclosed SessionState objects which are piling up and cause OOM..

There is special have been made to start a new sessionstate for every qtest; but the old one is not closed up to this [point|https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/20c9a3905f4b1b627c935ad54a53a7a59015587c/itests/util/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/QTestUtil.java#L1202]

this prevents running all {{TestNegativeCliDriver}} tests in one maven call....I keep getting OOMs

This issues sometimes appears on the ptest executor as well and its reported as a failed batch.


I've gone back in time a bit....seems like at c925cf8d2bdf646f5c3c57ed7252c01b2ab33eec it was ok to execute the whole batch; but at 1b4baf474c15377cc9f0bacdda317feabeefacaf and probably also at a42314deb07a1c8d9d4daeaa799ad1c1ebb0c6c9 its not possible anymore. I suspect that there is possibly another issue....or these are just the consequences that the sessionstate got heavier by a few hundred bytes; and made it easier to fill up the heap....
fields.summary: Qtests: running all cases from TestNegativeCliDriver results in OOMs

comments.body:
there were a bunch of classloaders creating an OOM situation
it turned out that {{VerifyingObjectStore}} is not matched by the if-s which control the "extra" cleanup which for datanucleus... 
HIVE-17980

[~ashutoshc] could you please take a look?
cc: [~alangates]
